ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 20 hours
At least 15 hours per week
4hrs
roughly 10 to 15 hours.
15-20 hours
15 hours per week
10+ (during weeks in which an assignment was due)
10 hrs
When we had an assignment, I spent upwards of 6 to 8 hours per week on this course.
approximately 10 hours.
8 hours
Very applied. Learned a lot.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Time consuming

This course was excellent! The course lectures were extremely well organized and carefully thought out. The lectures followed the recommended text book closely so that the readings really reinforced what we were learning in class. The homework assignments were long, but I greatly appreciated them in that they really helped to apply and synthesize the material we learned in class. This class has helped me make sense of all of the material I had learned in epidemiology and biostatistics courses over the past two years.
Similar to survival, course moves quickly and hw assignments are very burdensome
Less busy work
Great course, a lot of work, but taught very well.
Excellent instructor for the course
Excellent
This course is useful and fundamental. Somehow the stuff overlaps partly with categorical data analysis.
Strength: very thorough lecture notes. Weakness: actually lecture is very long and tedious.
Too much work although material is helpful
This course was a great way to be introduced and exposed to modeling concepts.

This course provides a thorough overview of quantitive epidemiological methods. It is fast paced and complements courses like Epi 3. I would recommend PhD students take this course before Advanced Epi.

This is a good course. There is a lot of material packed into a short amount of time, but I did learn a lot. The homework assignments were very long, but often did a good job of allowing me to understand the material. However, sometimes we were required to perform statistical tests by hand and it often consumed a lot of time. I understand the point of this is to understand how the tests are calculated instead of just using SAS to perform the test, but I still think sometimes it was unnecessary.
Very nice overview of epi study design from biostats perspective. Paralleled nicely with other concurrent classes in epi. Great sas tips
It was a good class.I would have liked to spend more time on model building, with more time on unusual or difficult situations and how to handle that, rather than more straightforward examples.
Great course. You gain a solid foundation in epidemiologic methods.
Very applied. Learned a lot.
A useful course.But a little bit overlap with the categorical data analysis course.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  good
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Patient and nice

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is an excellent professor. She is very familiar with the course material and has a clear, concise, and extremely well thought out and organized manner of conducting lecture. I really appreciated the effort she must have put into the lecture slides and thinking out the trajectory of the course. Maria really makes biostatistics accessible to those of us who don't have a biostats background. She is a wonderful professor and I only wish I had taken more courses with her before having to take the comprehensive exams. Bravo Maria!
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Dr. Ciarleglio has terrific slides and lectures
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Nice
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Dr. Ciarleglio does a great job at teaching the course, and I really appreciate the level of detail put into the lecture notes.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  I think Dr. Ciarleglio is a great instructor. She explains the material very clearly.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Very clear, nice instructor
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  The instructor is excellent, with great communicating skills and course material she prepared.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  She is very prepared and seems quite nice, but she just reads off the slides. But because the slides are so good, I really can't complain.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Professor was great in explaining concepts and notes were thorough.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Extremely knowledgeable and responsive to students. Her presentations are clear and thorough - great slides!

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria's course notes are incredible. I wish every professor could make slides as clear and useful as Maria does. I learned so much. Maria is a good lecturer too, although sometimes I felt like I didn't get any more from going to the class than I would have just reading the class notes on my own.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Very accessible

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  She did a great job of presenting the material. The slides were awesome.The lectures were not very interactive, but that is the nature of biostatistics lectures.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Dr. Ciarleglio is a fantastic teacher. She was very attentive to students and gave very thorough descriptions.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Very applied. Learned a lot.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Explicit and helpful.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Kyaw Sint  good
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Nice TA

Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Joe was an excellent TA! He really knew the course material and was such a help during office hours. He also made himself accessible outside of office hours. It is easy to tell he puts a lot of thought into how to explain the material and also into his grading practice. Thank you Joe!
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Did a nice job
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Wonderful
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Kyaw (Joe) did a great job as TA, was very patient and responsive to student questions and concerns.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  The TA was great!
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Nice TA, very dedicated to the course
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Pretty good.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  He clearly did not enjoy being a TA, and he made it exceedingly obvious that he did not want to have to answer any questions or deal with homework issues.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Great!
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  TA was always accessible and had a great understanding of the course material.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Kyaw was responsive to students and seemed to have a good grasp of the material. He returned assignments quickly and offered helpful feedback.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Joe was a good TA for this course, although I didn't really feel the need to attend office hours for this course. Homework feedback was good.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Joe was great! He graded those long homework assignments quickly and was very nice to interact with.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Learned a lot.
Instructor: Kyaw Sint  Helpful and responsible.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: good
Learning process is not easy
I highly recommend this course to all students at EPH. It is an excellent course that helps pull together the material we have learned in all of our different epidemiology and biostatistics courses.
This course is a lot of work but the material is presented very clearly
Meh
A great course, with a lot of work-will ultimately learn a great deal from the course.
Great course! Workload gets progressively heavier as the semester progresses.
I recommand
The course is very useful and fundamental.

Good course just for the lecture notes. Not enough SAS experience, although Maria does give SAS code to look at separately. The homework is a little annoying because she wanted us to do everything by hand, rather than use SAS, so each assignment took maybe 7-10 hours.
Too much work
Overall this course is a lot of work, but you will get a lot out of it. I think it is best suited for those with substantial experience with SAS and advanced model building.

This course was a good overview of study designs and methods for analysis of epidemiological data. Yes, I would definitely recommend this course to another student, however, I would warn them that the material can be very similar to the Categorical Data course.
Nice overview of study design with a biostats spin including sas tips

In this class, you learn some statistical methods. I didn't take the first two introductory classes in biostatistics here, but it seemed like it was repeating some of what I thought would be taught in those classes.The material wasn't new to me, but this is a required class, so not much point in recommending it or not. I wouldn't recommend it if you already know the material.
Great course!
Very applied. Learned a lot.
A useful course.Recommend.
